channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.
channel.copyright: Copyright:(C) Sat, 12 Oct 2024 15:03:52 IST Bennett Coleman & Co. Ltd, http://in.indiatimes.com/policyterms/1554651.cms

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Bomb survivors use Nobel Peace Prize win to share their anti-nuke message with younger generations
item.description: Nihon Hidankyo, an organization of atomic bomb survivors, won the Nobel Peace Prize for their activism against nuclear weapons. As survivors age, they are committed to passing their message to younger generations. High school students are inspired and pledging to continue the movement.

item.title: Planned nuclear plant in Kenyan top tourist hub, home to endangered species sparks protest
item.description: Dozens of protesters in Kilifi County, Kenya, rally against the construction of the country's first nuclear power plant, expressing concerns about environmental harm, health risks, and threats to livelihoods dependent on eco-tourism. Activists demand more public involvement and scrutiny of the project.

item.title: Israel army warns south Lebanon residents 'not to return to homes'
item.description: The Israeli military has advised residents of south Lebanon to avoid returning to their homes due to ongoing combat with Hezbollah militants. Both health workers and civilians are warned against using ambulances, which may be exploited by militants. Meanwhile, intense ground and air assaults continue in Gaza.

item.title: Karachi Airport explosion linked to foreign intelligence agency: Preliminary report
item.description: A preliminary report on the explosion near Karachi's Jinnah International Airport suggests the involvement of a foreign intelligence agency. The suicide bombing, believed to be orchestrated by the Balochistan Liberation Army, targeted Chinese engineers, killing two nationals and injuring 17 others, aiming to damage Pakistan-China relations. A case has been registered at the Airport police station under the supervision of the station house officer.

item.title: Fire on board oil tanker off Germany's Baltic Sea coast has been extinguished
item.description: A fire on the German-flagged oil tanker Annika off the Baltic Sea coast was successfully extinguished, according to authorities. The seven-member crew was evacuated, and black smoke was visible from the coast. The fire, originating from the engine or a paint storage room, did not spread to the cargo.

item.title: What is Trump's Operation Aurora?
item.description: Donald Trump introduced Operation Aurora at a rally in Aurora, Colorado, aiming to crack down on the Venezuelan gang, Tren de Aragua, by invoking the Alien Enemies Act of 1798. The plan includes deploying elite squads to deport gang members and enforcing strict penalties. He criticized the Biden-Harris administration for failing to manage national security and immigration policies.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Animals, savages': After Springfield attack, Trump again fuels anti-immigrant rhetoric
item.description: Donald Trump, during a speech in Aurora, Colorado, claimed that the country is occupied by criminal foreigners. He promised that November 5, 2024, will be Liberation Day. He proposed using the Alien Enemies Act for mass deportations. Local officials rebuffed his statements, saying Aurora is safe and not overrun by gangs.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Kamala Harris' Indian roots will be a significant advantage in the elections: Brookings Institute professor
item.description: US Vice President Kamala Harris and Donald Trump ramp up campaigns ahead of the November 5 election. Both hold events in Pennsylvania, with Harris backed by former President Obama. Polls show a tight race; key issues include the economy, immigration, and abortion rights. Voter turnout and Harris's Indian roots could influence the outcome.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Watch: 100s of raccoons surround a woman in Washington
item.description: A woman in Kitsap County was forced to flee her property after being surrounded by 50 to 100 aggressive raccoons, which she had been feeding for a decade. Initially starting with a few, the raccoon population exploded, demanding food constantly and causing damage to her home and car. Authorities advised her to stop feeding them, leading to their gradual dispersal.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Pakistan: Imran Khan's party to hold protest at Islamabad's D-Chowk on October 15
item.description: Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) plans a protest at Islamabad’s D-Chowk on October 15, the start of the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) Summit. PTI demands the release of detained members and protests alleged government oppression. Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif condemns the timing, comparing it to past disruptive protests. Tensions rise ahead of the international event.

item.title: Want to bet on US elections? This last-minute ruling has changed gambling rules
item.description: Millions of dollars are being wagered on the US presidential election after a court ruling legalised political gambling. Contracts for a Harris victory are trading near even with Trump's, despite concerns about misinformation. The legal debate continues, but markets remain open through Election Day.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Los Angeles recognises October 11 as National Coming Out Day
item.description: Los Angeles officially recognized October 11 as National Coming Out Day, commemorating the 1987 National March on Washington for Lesbian and Gay Rights. This initiative aims to create a safe and inclusive environment for the LGBTQ+ community. The city council made this move amid rising anti-LGBTQ+ legislation in the United States, emphasizing the need for acceptance and safety.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Hurricane Milton impact: New York airport faces delay due to equipment issues
item.description: Flights at Newark Liberty International Airport faced significant delays due to an FAA equipment issue and the effects of Hurricane Milton. Inbound flights were delayed by 90 minutes on average, while departures faced 30-minute delays. Although the equipment issue has been resolved, residual delays persisted. Travellers are advised to check with airlines for updates.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Residents slog through flooded streets, clear debris after Hurricane Milton tore through Florida
item.description: In Florida, Hurricane Milton caused severe flooding, debris, and tornadoes, resulting in ten deaths and ongoing rescues. The storm avoided a direct hit on Tampa but left many without power and contaminated water. Environmental concerns emerged with pollution spills, while some tourist areas began recovering.

item.title: Watch: Captain clings to cooler for 8 hours in sea before getting rescued during Hurricane Milton
item.description: A fishing boat captain was stranded for 8 hours in the Gulf of Mexico during Hurricane Milton. Facing extreme conditions, he was rescued by the US Coast Guard with waves up to 25 feet and winds up to 90 mph. The captain survived by clinging to a cooler and using his life jacket and emergency beacon.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Biden calls secretary his 'Boss' and refers to VP Harris as 'President' during Hurricane briefing
item.description: President Joe Biden provided an update on the federal response to recent hurricanes affecting North Carolina and Florida, highlighting efforts in power restoration and debris removal. Vice President Kamala Harris outlined federal support for essential supplies and assured continued assistance for recovery efforts.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'It’s OK, buddy': Dog rescued from floodwaters in Florida during Hurricane Milton
item.description: A dog was found tied to a fence in floodwaters on a Florida highway during Hurricane Milton evacuations and is now recovering at a rescue facility. Rescued by a Florida Highway Patrol trooper, the dog, now named Trooper, remains stressed and is undergoing rehabilitation. The Leon County Humane Society condemns abandoning pets during emergencies.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump to face women-only audience in Fox News Town Hall amid gender polling gap
item.description: Former President Trump will participate in a Fox News town hall next week aimed at female voters, moderated by Harris Faulkner. Despite strong male support, Trump trails behind Vice President Harris among women, as polls show significant gender-based differences in voter support.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Funeral home sued after mother’s body sent to wrong country, revealed through TikTok video
item.description: A New York family is suing Rivera Funeral Home for mistakenly sending their mother's casket to Guatemala instead of Ecuador. The funeral home's attempt to cover up the error was revealed through a TikTok video, leading to further distress for the family.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'He is a miracle baby': How did a Florida couple deliver their son during Hurricane Milton?
item.description: As Hurricane Milton approached Florida's Gulf Coast, Kenzie Lewellen went into labor in Port Charlotte. Amid the intensifying storm and flooding, Lewellen and her boyfriend rushed to Sarasota Memorial Hospital. After complications necessitated an emergency C-section, Dewey Lester Bennett IV was safely delivered. Despite the challenging conditions, the couple expressed immense joy and relief.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
